citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Female cavalier (DOB 10-7-18, tag# 119) was observed to have teeth covered with plaque and tartar, and one of her
upper right middle teeth behind the long canine tooth was slightly loose to the touch. Her gums appeared redder by the
upper teeth and those teeth had less gums than normal. These are signs of dental problems and if not treated can cause
health problems and discomfort. Ensure to contact the (AV) attending veterinarian to have this dog evaluated and treated
per the AV's guidance.
***Correct by February 8, 2024.

On the south row of the indoor middle run housing two dogs, there was a pipe kept in a drain (to keep it from plugging up)
that had rough/sharp edges to the touch. Also, a piece of flashing in the same pen had a corner folded out in an area
dogs can contact and it was sharp to the touch. Sharp/rough edges can injure dogs. Ensure that all surfaces dogs can
touch are kept free from sharp and rough edges.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee and facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Female cavalier (DOB 10-7-18, tag# 119) was observed to have teeth covered with plaque and tartar, and one of her 
upper right middle teeth behind the long canine tooth was slightly loose to the touch. Her gums appeared redder by the 
upper teeth and those teeth had less gums than normal. These are signs of dental problems and if not treated can cause 
health problems and discomfort. Ensure to contact the (AV) attending veterinarian  to have this dog evaluated and treated 
per the AV's guidance.  
***Correct by February 8, 2024. 
3.1(c)(1)(ii)  Repeat
   
Housing facilities, general. 
On the south row of the indoor middle run housing two dogs, there was a pipe kept in a drain (to keep it from plugging up) 
that had rough/sharp edges to the touch. Also, a piece of flashing in the same pen had a corner folded out in an area 
dogs can contact and it was sharp to the touch. Sharp/rough edges can injure dogs. Ensure that all surfaces dogs can 
touch are kept free from sharp and rough edges. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee and facility representative. 
 
 n
